Name: Stoop line stands.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to stoop line stands.

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
A motion was made that this Introduction be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows: 
	Section 1.  Subdivision a of section 20-237 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by section four of introduction number 939-A as adopted by the council on December 18, 2012, is amended to read as follows:
	§ 20-237. Stoop line stands; restrictions. a. Stoop line stands shall not [extend farther than three feet from the front of any premises and shall not] exceed seven feet in height. Every stoop line stand shall be maintained wholly within the stoop line and shall not obstruct the free use of the sidewalk by pedestrians.  Stoop line stands shall not exceed ten feet in length nor four feet in width, except as provided in subdivision b of this section.
§2. This local law shall take effect on the same date as introduction number 939-A, as adopted by the council on December 18, 2012, takes effect.




R.C.
LS 4338
12/27/12
